item.title: diffudist 1.0 R package
item.description:
Check out the R package diffudist, now also on CRAN! The diffudist package allows you to easily evaluate (and plot with ggplot2) diffusion distances between the nodes of a complex networks and, in so doing, analaysing the functional shape and diffusion geometry of your networks. For more details, check out this detailed package vignette and the two scientific papers Phys. Rev. Lett. 118, 168301 – 2017 and Phys. Rev. E 103, 042301 – 2021 (also here).

Installation

# either
install.packages("diffudist")
# or
devtools::install_github("gbertagnolli/diffudist")

The package website, has been built using pkgdown pkgdown.r-lib.org.

Releasing (well documented and maintained) code makes Scientific Research and Science better!

item.title: intsegration 1.0 R package
item.description:
Check out the R package intsegration where you can find the function (and code) for the evaluation of the global communication efficiency (GCE) of weighted networks (among others). The intsegration package is related to two publications EPJ Data Sci. 10, 3 (2021) and to appear soon in Comm. Phys (2021).

Installation

devtools::install_github("gbertagnolli/intsegration")

The package website, has been built using pkgdown (pkgdown.r-lib.org).

Releasing code makes Scientific Research and Science better!

item.title: muxViz v3.1 R package
item.description:
I had the great opportunity to contribute to muxViz, building the R package muxViz that now can be installed as easy as

devtools::install_github("manlius/muxViz")

I built the package website using pkgdown (cf.pkgdown.r-lib.org), which makes the whole process easy (and fun).

There is still work to do–enriching the documentation and fixing bugs, among others–before releasing it to CRAN, but it’s still a result and a pleasure. Realising code makes Scientific Research and Science better!

Tnx to sprint efforts by @gdeandajauregui & Coll. + @GiuliaTtt invaluable contributions, I can say it: #muxViz 3.1 is out! Full R package, w/ minimal doc + worked examples.
Many thanks for the patience, but it was worth the pain. The accompanying book is coming soon... pic.twitter.com/zEuGYGJ6tP
